adjectives.description: downstream (comparative farther or further downstream, superlative farthest or furthest downstream)

entries.meaning: Further along in the flow of current, in relation to a river, stream, bloodstream, or other flow of fluid.
examples: She lives downstream from the dam.

definitionGroups.group: (metaphoric) Occurring later than something else; (also, usually, especially) influenced by something else; being a consequence of something else.

entries.meaning: (computer networking) In the direction from the server to the client.
(biology) Towards the 3′ end of a DNA molecule.
Following the path of a river or stream
examples: We spent the day paddling downstream in our canoes.

verbs.description: downstream (third-person singular simple present downstreams, present participle downstreaming, simple past and past participle downstreamed)
